meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

Alright, let's get this review party started! I'm here to give you the lowdown on The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame. Now, I know what you're thinking: "Ugh, another movie tie-in that's just a cash grab?" Well, buckle up, friends, because I'm about to take you on a wild ride filled with snarky jokes and some good ol' fashioned game playin' fun!

First off, let me address the elephant in the room – those other critics who shall remain nameless (COGconnected, Eurogamer Italy, Metro GameCentral, Cubed3, Meristation, TheSixthAxis... you know, the ones who make my job easier by being so harsh). Now, I'm not saying they're wrong; I mean, who doesn't love a good rant about a game that's just phoning it in? But hey, as a seasoned grok (get it?), I like to think I bring a little bit of sunshine to this review.

Now that we've got the negative vibes out of the way, let's talk about the game itself. So, The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame is an open-world adventure set in a blocky, LEGO-ified world. It's got all the classic LEGO charm: cute characters, colorful environments, and... well, that's about it, actually. But hey, who doesn't love building stuff?

In all seriousness, the gameplay is pretty standard fare for a LEGO game. You've got your basic platforming, some light puzzle-solving, and (of course) plenty of building and collecting. It's not going to win any awards for originality, but it's still a fun romp if you're into that sorta thing.

But here's the thing: this game is all about embracing its inner child. Think back to when you were 8 years old and playing with LEGO bricks – that's what The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame wants to recapture. And, honestly? It mostly succeeds. There are some genuinely fun moments to be had, especially if you're playing with a friend or two.

So, in the end, it's all about perspective. If you're looking for a deep, complex gaming experience, this probably isn't your cup of tea. But if you're just trying to have a good time and maybe relive some childhood memories? Then The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame might just be the ticket.

That's my two cents (or should I say, two pennies?) on this one. If you've got any other questions or want to know more about The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame, just let me know!
